macro_events.notes: Fluctuated from mid-40s in late 2025 to high-20s by Jan 2026. Resolution: NBER announcement or 2 consecutive negative GDP quarters (Q2 2025-Q4 2026).
Down from 42 cents in July 2025 to 25 cents. Jamie Dimon warned 2026 could be rough despite falling odds.
Market exists but exact probability not retrievable from search. Resolution: BEA advance estimate for Q4 2026 showing full-year growth below 0.
36% probability of CPI inflation exceeding 3% in any month of 2026. Resolution source: BLS CPI reports.

macro_events.event: Fed rate cuts in 2026 - 0 cuts (0 bps)
macro_events.notes: Part of multi-outcome market. Fed held rates steady at 3.5-3.75% in Jan 2026 after 3 consecutive cuts in 2025.

macro_events.event: Fed rate cuts in 2026 - 1 cut (25 bps)
macro_events.notes: Fed dot plot median anticipates one 25bp cut in 2026.

macro_events.event: Fed rate cuts in 2026 - 3 cuts (75 bps)
macro_events.notes: Most probable single outcome at 27%. Bankrate also estimates three cuts in 2026.
79% probability of no change at March 2026 FOMC. 18% probability of 25bps cut.

macro_events.event: Supreme Court rules in favor of Trump tariffs
macro_events.notes: 31% odds, up from 21% on Jan 17. Relevant because tariff rulings affect semiconductor import costs.

company_specific.event: Intel x TSMC joint venture announced before July 2025
company_specific.notes: Market for Intel-TSMC JV announcement by June 30, 2025. Reports from April 2025 indicated a tentative deal was reached. Exact current probability not retrievable. This market likely already resolved.

industry_events.notes: Section 232 proclamation on Jan 14, 2026 imposing 25% tariff on specified semiconductor articles effective Jan 15. Targets advanced computing chips (NVIDIA H200, AMD MI325X). Exemptions for US data centers, R&D, startups, consumer applications. July 1 update on negotiations may lead to additional tariffs.
Taiwan struck a deal for lower tariff rates in exchange for investing in US chip manufacturing. Direct impact on TSM as largest Taiwanese chipmaker.

geopolitical_events.event: China invades Taiwan by end of 2026
geopolitical_events.notes: Down from ~30% in late 2025 during heightened Taiwan Strait tensions. Resolution: China commences military offensive to establish control over any portion of Taiwan by Dec 31, 2026.
Very low probability for imminent invasion.

geopolitical_events.event: China x Taiwan military clash before 2027
geopolitical_events.notes: Higher than invasion probability. Defined as missile strikes, artillery fire, exchange of gunfire, or direct military engagement. Non-violent actions (warning shots, etc.) do not qualify. $357K volume.
Naval/aerial blockade preventing normal commercial traffic for 24+ hours. Lower than invasion odds.

no_coverage.notes: No specific prediction market found on Polymarket for semiconductor/chip export bans. Search returned only unrelated ban markets (TikTok, X platform bans).
No prediction market found for AI spending or AI capex levels. Polymarket AI markets focus on model quality rankings and product launches, not spending amounts.

no_coverage.searched_query: polymarket semiconductor tariff chip tariff 2026 prediction market odds
no_coverage.notes: No prediction market specifically for semiconductor tariffs. However, 25% semiconductor tariff was already enacted via Section 232 on Jan 15, 2026. General tariff markets exist (Supreme Court ruling on tariffs at 31%).

no_coverage.event: Kalshi federal reserve interest rate 2026 (specific Kalshi page)
no_coverage.notes: Kalshi site search returned general news articles about Fed decisions rather than specific Kalshi market pages. Fed held rates at 3.5-3.75% in Jan 2026. CME FedWatch shows market pricing of at most 2 cuts in 2026.

Kalshi has annual GDP and quarterly GDP markets but exact probabilities for specific growth brackets were not retrievable from search results. Markets exist at kalshi.com/markets/kxgdpyear/annual-gdp.
